title: Laura Palacios Falk
text:
Laura is a data scientist with a career focused on data management, reporting, and analytics. She specializes in long-term datasets, ranging from ecology to human health surveillance. Laura has strong technical expertise in R, Python, and SQL, and a wide range of skills in data science, including database management, creating reproducible workflows, and applying machine learning techniques. She is highly organized, efficiency-driven, and has a love of nature.  Education

M.S. in Data Science | 2023 University of Arizona
B.S. in Renewable Natural Resources | 2013  University of Arizona
B.S. in Animal Science | 2013 University of Arizona

 Current Affiliations University of Arizona - Zuckerman College of Public Health Department of Epidemiology and Biostatistics
The Arizona CoVHORT Join Here!
Past Affiliations  National Park Service - Sonoran Desert Network  National Park Service - Southwest Network Collaboration University of Arizona - Data Science Institute    Tags: Tucson, Lower Santa Cruz River, E. coli, Escherichia coli, COVID, Covid-19

title: Publications
text:
Authorship note: Materials published before 2023 appear under the name Laura Palacios.

Determining the incidence, risk factors and biological drivers of irritable bowel syndrome (IBS) as part of the constellation of postacute sequelae of SARS-CoV-2 infection (PASC) outcomes in the Arizona CoVHORT-GI: a longitudinal cohort study. BMJ open, 15(1), p.e095093.

Site Visitors

title: Instruction and Presentations
text:
Instructional Materials
Instructional materials were created in collaboration with Samantha Olivares-Mejia for the Southwest Network Collaboratione . They are intended for users with little to no R coding experience.
GitHub Tutorial  A beginners tutorial on how to use GitHub. 
R Coding Basics  Basics lesson for R coding. 
R Code Data Wrangling Techniques  This Repository contains a fill-in the blank instructional materials, with the suffix “Learner.RMD”. Files with the suffix “Main.RMD” and “Main.html” contain answers to the learner files.   Main (Answer) file previews are linked below. - Session 1   - Session 2   - Session 3 
Presentations
WiDS Tucson 2025   - API Key Basics: Unlocking Data Possibilities
Santa Cruz River Research Days 2023   - Tree-Based Machine Learning Technology for remote, real-time Escherichia coli level prediction in the Upper Santa Cruz River
Tri-national Sonoran Desert Symposium 2019  - Springs Monitoring Protocols in the Sonoran Desert Network.
Santa Cruz River Research Days 2017  - Ten Years of Ecosystem Monitoring at Tumacácori National Historical Park
